thread.title: AD Pat Haden felt lightheaded before game, but is OK
thread.title_full: USC AD Pat Haden felt lightheaded before game, but is OK

author: Scott Wolf
title: AD Pat Haden felt lightheaded before game, but is OK
text:
USC athletic director Pat Haden speaks with the media about why he fired Steve Sarkisian on Oct. 13, 2015. (AP Photo/Richard Hartog)
SOUTH BEND, Ind. — SC athletic director Pat Haden dropped to a knee and touched his chest on the sideline before Saturday night’s game against Notre Dame.
Haden was taken to the locker room by USC team doctors and stadium first aid workers and was in stable condition, according to a USC spokesperson. Haden felt light headed, according to the spokesperson.
Midway through the second quarter, the spokesperson said word from the locker room was that Haden felt “fine.” With the temperature at kickoff around 43 degrees, it was not known if Haden would come out to watch the game.
• USC vs. Notre Dame: Live updates
This was a stressful week for Haden, who was forced to announce USC coach Steve Sarkisian was on a leave of absence Sunday, fired Sarkisian on Monday and held a press conference Tuesday.
Haden experienced an undisclosed health condition in 2014 that forced him to take time off work.
